reviews.text: Just got back from a trip to Ireland where we spent one night at the Pier House. My husband and I loved it! Very modern and clean, as well as nice and quiet. Ann, the proprietor, is very kind and fixes lovely breakfast! Additionally, she was able to give us tips on the next towns we planned to visit. The location of the Pier House is absolutely great--right by the water and by the downtown area filled with shops and pubs. A true gem!
reviews.title: Pier House was fabulous!
great choice
reviews.text: Have just returned from a short stay at the pier house. The place is very tastefully decorated with lots of nice modern touches - definitely not your average B and B. Fabulous breakfasts with a great choice and a very welcoming host who managed to be attentive but not obtrusive. I would recommend the pier house to anyone who wants 5 star comforts without the price or the anonymity of a large hotel.

I stayed at Pier House with a few friends over a December weekend for my birthday. Ann Hegarty was a very thoughtful and informative hostess. Our room was very tastefully decorated - we had a little alcove outside with an iron table and two chairs. My friends had a private balcony. There was also a room for everyones use to read newspapers, listen to music, etc. It was very well thought out. The breakfasts were very good too. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Amazing b&b

reviews.text: You can't go past The Pierhouse B&B - aside from being very modern, it's in a great location. The owners are very friendly - lots of Irish charm and the breakfast was fabulous. If anything our room was a bit small but it was still comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B
Loved it, full of charm.
reviews.text: My mum and I recently returned from a stay at the Pier House in Kinsale. We had a fantastic time, the Guest House was lovely, spotlessley clean and set in lovely surroundings. All the staff were helpful and efficient and the landlady Ann was very hospitable and gave us a very warm welcome which made our stay very enjoyable. She cooked an excellent breakfast with a range of choices on offer. Pier House is in an excellent location in Kinsale, right in the centre of everything - but it is set in its own private garden.

We had read great reviews about the Pier House, which is why we booked our room here, and overall we were very pleased! It is definitely not your traditional B&B (hence, "boutique hotel"). The services are there, but there's not as much a sense of "responsibility" to the owners or to the other guests to be around and social. Which is kind of nice if you're just looking to get away, as we were. It is a little pricey, but it was a fun splurge for us, and we thought it was worth it.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay!

reviews.text: The town of Kinsale is lovely, and the Pier House is VERY centrally located, which is great when you have shopping to do and it's a rainy day! We spent much of one day going from store to hotel to another store and back again, to drop off our purchases.
reviews.title: Maybe we were expecting too much...
A lovely place to stay
reviews.text: Ann and Pat couldn't have been nicer or more helpful... especially when we had problems with our rental car. We would definitely consider staying there again, should we be fortunate enough to return to Kinsale someday.

reviews.title: Oasis in Kinsale Stay Here!!!
reviews.text: Having read such glowing reviews both on TripAdvisor and in independent guides maybe our expectations were too high. I will not reiterate the well described good points; so apologies if what follows seems a bit negative.

reviews.title: Nice, but overpriced
reviews.text: I reckon the only rooms worth staying in would be those with balconies and views (the minority)- ours was VERY dark; no amount of decoration can make up for the need to have the lights on at the height of summer to read - it would have helped if all the lights were working; even though this was noticed at check in it was not rectified.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only regret for staying at the Pier House is that we didn't stay for 2 nights. We had a long day of traveling from Dublin to Kinsale and arrived at the Pier House at 7pm. The rooms were perfect, big, clean, airy, all with a small outside patio. The hosts were great, very friendly and breakfast was perfect as well! The breakfast room was so well decorated!! Would highly recommend a few nights here.
reviews.title: Warm and Welcoming B and B

reviews.text: After a six week tour of Asia with another couple, the four of us flew from Beijing, China to Ireland arriving in Cork around 7:30 PM April 19. Since I knew we would be exhausted I had made the reservation for the Pier House on the internet several months previously intending to stay one night and then, when rested, move on. When we arrived, in spite of the late hour (after going through customs, getting the car, etc.), Anne Hegarty, the proprietor, met us at the door and helped with our luggage while assuring us that the car would be fine. The Pier House was so delightful we stayed an extra day scrapping our intentions to free-lance for a day. Anne
reviews.title: The Pier House: a Real Touch of Irish Hospitality

likes.liked: — The homey atmosphere and the proprietor, Anne Hegarty

reviews.text: is a delight and was very helpful to us in planning our sight-seeing for the next couple of days.
reviews.title: Lovely stay at Pier House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While not plush, the rooms were comfortable and pleasant with great bathrooms, there is a bright and cheery lounge with wireless internet
reviews.title: "Lost" our reservation...

likes.disliked: — The horrible and unprofessional way we were treated, and the situation handled.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: access, the grounds are impeccable and Anne's breakfast first-rate. They also have a hot tub and sauna although we didn't use them. And it is perfectly located for walking around the town. Staying at the Pier House is like staying at the fine home of old friends (except that old friends don't wait on you hand and foot!) We would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Kinsale or the neighboring towns.
reviews.title: Paradise in Kinsale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a find! A stylish and funky place to stay in the very heart of Kinsale. Lovely rooms, with modern colour schemes and lovely imported asian furniture with balcony overlooking gardens, stunning art collection, a rooftop jacuzzi and a wine service station so you can B.Y.O. a bottle or two! We really enjoyed our stay, the owner was delightful and booked us in to a nice restaurant nearby. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Boutique Guesthouse

likes.liked: — the feel of a small boutique hotel

reviews.title: Better than the average B&B
reviews.text: A comfortable place to stay, with more flair and style than the average B&B. The bed was comfortable, the breakfasts good, and the sauna was a nice touch. However, it was on the expensive side and, for the price, the bathroom was disappointing - really cramped. No fault of the hotel, but its worth being aware that parking is v hard and you may have to drag your luggage a long way. Kinsale is good for foodies, but is clogged with traffic and maybe doesn't live up to the hype.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights in the pier house recently for the august bank holiday weekend and would definately recommend it for a short break - we stayed in room 9 and thought it was so much better than some 4 star hotels - sleigh bed, beautiful decor and colour co-ordination and lovely bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At 70euro per person it's certainly up there with hotel prices but it is definately worth the money - probably wouldn't advise groups or budget holiday makers to stay here but its perfect for couples or those who appreciate those little extras. Breakfast is fantastic with a full menu to choose from and worth getting up for every day - on our last morning they even brought breakfast up to us - the staff are so nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, beautiful rooms, kind hostess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in the middle of everything. kinsale is a beautiful town and the pier house made our stay even more enjoyable!
reviews.title: A comfortable and friendly oasis

likes.liked: — Felt comfortable from arrival to departure
